intro: Tuberaria villosissima var. sicula, commonly known as the Sicilian tuberaria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in gardens and botanical collections.
